page.title: 15WETHERBY SCHOOL NURSE
page.content: The school nurse began her training in 1951. After she had qualified she married and left nursing to have her family, then in 1965 she came to Wetherby as a school nurse. She has been in the nursing profession now for 34 years. She visits six schools, dealing with about 880 children. Her role is to help children get the best out of school. She inspects their hair and eyes and does hearing tests, as the most common problems she finds are hearing and sight defects and head lice. If she finds anything seriously wrong she sends the child to the school doctor. Our nurse has never worn a uniform because she does not want to frighten the younger children. To be a school nurse you have to like children and ours most certainly does.
